page.title: 05Garden Opening,Cortachy.
page.content: Once a year usually at the end of May{the gardens of Cortachy Castle are {open to to the public.}At this time of the year the rhodedendrons and azaleas are in full bloom and people enjoy seeing them,particularly by the pond,where they grow in profusion. {Afternoon teas}are served in the castle.The cost is{Â£1.}For this you can eat as much as you like.It took the cook three hours,using large quantities of ingredients to bake all the{scones,pancakes,fruit loaves and {cakes}and to make hundreds of {sandwiches.} On the lawns surrounding the castle {a pipe band plays,}the local{Brownies {sell ice-cream}and the{Guides have a {plant stall.} Proceeds go to the Gardens Fund of the National Trust for Scotland and other charities.
